semantic_title: Infectious Disease Carrier Status (Z22) - Definition and Clinical Significance
section_path: Section I > C. Chapter-Specific Coding Guidelines > 21. Factors Influencing Health Status > c. Categories of Z Codes > 3) Status

content.full_text: Carrier status indicates that a person harbors the specific organisms of a disease without manifest symptoms and is capable of transmitting the infection. (Evidence: pg no: 94, L43)
content.summary: Z22 codes indicate carrier status where person harbors disease organisms without symptoms but can transmit infection (Evidence: pg no: 94, L43)
key_concepts: Harbors disease organisms (Evidence: pg no: 94, L43)
No manifest symptoms (Evidence: pg no: 94, L43)
Capable of transmission (Evidence: pg no: 94, L43)
Infectious disease carrier (Evidence: pg no: 94, L42)

detailed_rules.rule_text: Person harbors organisms without symptoms but can transmit infection (Evidence: pg no: 94, L43)
detailed_rules.explanation: Carrier status means asymptomatic harboring of infectious organisms with transmission capability (Evidence: pg no: 94, L43)

workflow_steps: Step 1: Confirm presence of infectious organisms
Step 2: Verify absence of disease symptoms

code_ranges.description: Carrier of infectious disease (Evidence: pg no: 94, L42)
code_ranges.requirement: Use when person harbors organisms without symptoms but can transmit
usage_rules: Patient must be asymptomatic (Evidence: pg no: 94, L43)
Must be capable of transmission (Evidence: pg no: 94, L43)

coding_scenarios.documentation_example: Patient is known hepatitis B carrier. No symptoms of hepatitis. Laboratory tests confirm presence of hepatitis B surface antigen.
step_by_step: Step 1: Confirm hepatitis B organism presence
Step 2: Verify patient has no hepatitis symptoms
Step 3: Assign Z22.51 for hepatitis B carrier

correct_coding.rationale: Patient harbors hepatitis B without symptoms but can transmit (Evidence: pg no: 94, L43)

incorrect_coding.rationale: Patient has no manifest symptoms of disease
incorrect_coding.common_mistake: Using active disease codes for asymptomatic carriers

warnings: Do not use if patient has manifest symptoms (Evidence: pg no: 94, L43)
best_practices: Confirm asymptomatic status before using Z22 codes
common_mistakes: Using carrier codes when patient has active disease
Confusing carrier status with active infection
tips: Carrier status requires absence of symptoms with transmission capability
implementation_notes: Important for infection control and public health
